meanings.definition: A type of berry that is a hybrid between a raspberry and a blackberry.
meanings.sent1: Loganberries grow on vines and have a unique flavor.
meanings.sent2: I picked some fresh loganberries from the garden for our dessert.
meanings.sent3: Why did the loganberries refuse to play hide and seek? Because they always stand out!
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as sweet and distinct as a loganberry in a field of strawberries.
meanings.sent5: The loganberries gleamed like tiny jewels in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The fruit of the loganberry plant, typically dark red in color.
meanings.sent1: The loganberries were ripe and ready to be made into jam.
meanings.sent2: She savored the juicy sweetness of the loganberries in her smoothie.
meanings.sent3: The loganberries giggled as they rolled off the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent4: His cheeks turned as red as loganberries when she complimented his cooking.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the loganberries filled the room, enticing everyone to try a taste.
